article:
{{automatic Taxobox
| name = Trechnotherians fossil_range = Middle Jurassic - Recent,
|image=Kangaroo and joey03.jpg |image_caption=Kangaroo with her joey
| unranked_ordo_authority = McKenna 1975 subdivision_ranks = Clades
| subdivision =
*Cladotheria (including modern therians) *Symmetrodonta
| synonyms =
Theriiformes Rowe, 1988 }} 'Trechnotheria' is a group of
mammals that includes the therians and some fossil mammals from the Mesozoic
Era. In the Jurassic through Cretaceous periods, the group was endemic to what
would be Asia and Africa {{cite web
 | title = Trechnotheria - Mammalia work = Paleobiology Database url = http://paleodb.org/cgi-
 | bin/bridge.pl?action=checkTaxonInfo&taxon_no=64369&is_real_user=1
 | PaleoBiology Database: Trechnotheria, basic info accessdate = 2009-10-21
}}

Trechnotheria has been assigned various ranks, but was originally called a
"superlegion" by the original author.
{{cite book
 | authors = McKenna, Malcolm C., & Bell, Susan K. year = 2000 title =
 | Classification of Mammals above the Species Level publisher = University of
 | Chicago Press page = 43
}} One reference has defined the Trechnotheria as the clade comprising the
last common ancestor of [[Zhangheotherium]] and living therian mammals, and all
its descendants. {{cite book
 | authors = Kielan-Jaworowska, Zofia; Cifelli, Richard; & Luo Zhe-Xi year =
 | title = Mammals from the age of dinosaurs: origins, evolution, and structure
 | publisher = Columbia University Press page = 366 isbn = 978-0-231-11918-4
}}
